PathOfBuilding.Notes:
3.9 Changes:
NOTE: The single target damage is not a top tier performer in 3.9. An incredible map farmer and very fun but I would recommend Lacerate, Storm Burst or Molten Strike over this for bossing.
- Added a new leveling gear section and a new leveling tree! The item set can be changed using a drop down menu right above weapon 1. The leveling tree can be changed using a drop down menu just to the right of the Patreon button when viewing the tree!
- With the arrival of 3.9 the defensive capabilities of virtually all monsters have been increased. This is especially apparent against rares, uniques and bosses. The game as a whole has become more difficult.
- Many new items and interactions haven't been tested as the league isn't out yet! If you're running this as a league starter mix in new things and try out whatever seems interesting!
- Use any relevant Awakened Support gems you can get your hands on!
- I would highly advise using an elementally focused melee skill in the early leveling. I love rocking molten strike early on. Frost blades can be fantastic as well.
- For any league starters the only real restriction is the Combat Focus jewels. Pick them up at your earliest convenience as the league progresses.
- Multiple small changes to gear were made to improve evasion, life and damage. We also made several changes to avoid Elder/Shaper items due to their reduced availability in 3.9. Several uniques were also dropped in order to make the build easier to gear. - Inpulsas was swapped out for Loreweave as the sockets were too difficult to get on Inpulsas. I included a variety of other alternatives to Inpulsas as well! However if you can manage the correct colors running Inpulsas is still powerful. - Watcher's Eye was dropped due to probable scarcity! - Both the Assassins Mark ring and the Circle of Regret was dropped for now. They were swapped for two rare steel rings.
- Many small optimizations were made on the skill trees in order to improve life and dps.
- I swapped Lightning Penetration into the main links for Wild Strike. Running this or Ruthless is a better all around option for single target damage than running Ancestral Call. However in mapping situations running the anointment Tribal Fury or looking for the new modifier "strike skills target an additional enemy" will boost our clear speed heavily. Of course if you want to still run Ancestral Call during leveling or mapping or if you're dealing plenty of damage already the additional chains can do some insane work. Having Ancestral Call in the links may be worth it for many of you, at least until you have Tribal Fury or the new modifier!
3.8 Changes:
- For those wanting to go the Inpulsa route you can use the delve craft to get three guaranteed red sockets, it might take a couple of tries but you should be able to get at least 4 red sockets fairly easily. Please keep in mind that Inpulsa is not required for the build. A Loreweave or any of the otheralternatives listed will serve the build very well and for much cheaper.
- Both combat focus jewels will work in the slots that I described for them. They require a combined 40 of both attributes meaning that if you have 40 of one attribute and 0 of another the jewel will still function. Furthermore PoB ignores the node coldhearted calculation when estimating attribute totals in the top jewel slot. It will function as intended in game.
- Should have indicated in the guide that other forms of elemental damage (Cold and Fire) have their damage contributions halved by the elemental focus jewels. Focus all of your efforts on stacking only physical and lightning damage with this build. Especially on powerful sources like the claws.
- Physical damage only claws will be the strongest option available for the build.
- Steelskin at level 19 has been setup with Cast When Damage Taken at level 17. This is balanced so that Steelskin grants us with a substantial amount of damage prevention but ensures the gems will support each other and trigger properly.
